definitions: Reduced in size or extent; made smaller.
Acquired or incurred (a disease or debt).
Entered into a formal agreement or contract.
Shortened (a word or phrase) by omitting letters or sounds.
examples: The pupil of her eye contracted in the bright light.
He contracted a severe illness while traveling.
They contracted to build the new bridge.
The word 'do not' is often contracted to 'don't'.
